name: Gluten-Free Teff Crackers
author: Timbo
summary: Super easy recipe that everyone can enjoy including vegetarians, vegans, gluten-free, kids, and everyone else! The tapioca helps bind everything together and makes for a wholesome nutritious snack that tastes great! These are incredibly nutritious with the only oil coming from the pan and whatever might be in the seeds. They go great with dips or a strong base for appetizers.
ingredients: ¼ cup pepitas (roasted green pumpkin seeds)
directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)

Stir water, teff flour, and tapioca flour together in a bowl until smooth; add sunflower seeds, pepitas, sesame seeds, flax seeds, teff, black sesame seeds, and 1/4 teaspoon salt and stir until mixture is soupy
Pour mixture onto the prepared baking sheet, tapping pan on the counter to evenly distribute mixture in the pan
Bake in the preheated oven until crackers are crisp, about 40 minutes
